UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the Sakhi Circle application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

aadhaarVerified.description: Indicates if the user has been verified using Aadhaar (optional).

verificationStatus.description: The user's verification status (e.g., pending, verified, rejected).

lookingToConnectFor.description: User's reasons for connecting (friends, business, learning, etc.).

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a post in the Sakhi Circle application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Post entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the post was created. Should be a server timestamp.

image.description: URL of an image attached to the post (optional).

isAnonymous.description: True if the post is made anonymously.

Chat.title: Chat
Chat.description: Represents a chat between two or more users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Chat entity.

participants.description: References to UserProfiles participating in the chat. (Relationship: UserProfile N:N Chat)

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the chat was created.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message within a chat.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Message entity.

senderId.description: Reference to UserProfile who sent the message. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Message)

content.description: Content of the message (text, image URL, video URL, voice note URL).

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

Community.title: Community
Community.description: Represents a community in the Sakhi Circle application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Community entity.

leaderId.description: Reference to UserProfile who is the leader of the community. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Community)

memberIds.description: References to UserProfiles who are members of the community. (Relationship: UserProfile N:N Community)

id.description: Unique identifier for the KittyGroup entity.

memberIds.description: References to UserProfiles who are members of the kitty group. (Relationship: UserProfile N:N KittyGroup)

nextWinnerSelectionDate.description: Date of the next winner selection.

MarketplaceListing.title: MarketplaceListing
MarketplaceListing.description: Represents a listing in the women's business marketplace.

id.description: Unique identifier for the MarketplaceListing entity.

sellerId.description: Reference to UserProfile who is selling the product/service. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N MarketplaceListing)

category.description: Category of the product/service (food, handmade, fashion, etc.).

Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a learning course in the Sakhi Circle application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Course entity.

instructorId.description: Reference to UserProfile who is the instructor of the course. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Course)

enrolledUserIds.description: References to UserProfiles who are enrolled in the course. (Relationship: UserProfile N:N Course)

Event.title: Event
Event.description: Represents an event in the Sakhi Circle application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Event entity.

organizerId.description: Reference to UserProfile who is organizing the event. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Event)

attendeeIds.description: References to UserProfiles who are attending the event. (Relationship: UserProfile N:N Event)

dateTime.description: Date and time of the event.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability for the Sakhi Circle application. It strictly adheres to Authorization Independence by denormalizing authorization data, avoiding `get()` calls in security rules, and enabling atomic operations. Structural Segregation is used to maintain homogeneous security postures within collections, enhancing rule simplicity. Access Modeling employs consistent patterns, using path-based ownership for user-owned data and membership maps for collaborative resources. A top-level `/posts` collection has been added for efficient querying of the global feed, which is a common requirement for social applications. 

**Authorization Independence:**

*   **UserProfile:** User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}`. This provides inherent ownership and eliminates the need to check parent documents for authorization. The `userId` is implicitly the document owner.
*   **Posts:** All posts are stored in a top-level `/posts` collection. Each post document contains a denormalized `author` object with the author's ID, which allows security rules to verify ownership on writes (`create`, `update`, `delete`).
*   **Chats & Messages:** Chats are stored in `/chats/{chatId}` with a `members` map containing user IDs and roles. Messages are stored in `/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId}` and inherit authorization context from the parent `chatId`. The `chats` document includes the denormalized `members` map to avoid server-side `get()` calls in security rules.
*   **Communities:** Communities are stored in `/communities/{communityId}` with a `members` map. The leader is stored inside the document. This enables membership-based authorization. 
*   **Kitty Groups:** Kitty Groups are stored in `/kitty_groups/{kittyGroupId}` with a `members` map to define group members. This membership map is leveraged for authorization. 
*   **Marketplace Listings:** Listings are stored under `/marketplace_listings/{listingId}` with a denormalized `sellerId` field. This allows rules to directly verify the seller.
*   **Courses:** Courses are stored in `/courses/{courseId}` with denormalized `enrolledUserIds` and `instructorId` fields. Instructor and enrolled users can be quickly verified in rules.
*   **Events:** Events are stored in `/events/{eventId}` with denormalized `attendeeIds` and `organizerId` fields. Organizer and attendees can be quickly verified in rules.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

*   **List Operations:** The data structure supports secure list operations. Listing all posts is done by querying the top-level `/posts` collection. Listing communities where a user is a member is done by querying `/communities` filtering on the `members` map. Segregation of data based on ownership and clear membership maps enables efficient and secure filtering.

**Invariants:**

*   **Ownership:** The structure clearly defines ownership, either through denormalized fields (`author` object in `/posts`, `sellerId` in `/marketplace_listings`).
*   **Timestamps:** Timestamps can be enforced in rules. Using serverTimestamp() is highly encouraged.
*   **Denormalized Data:** The design explicitly defines which data is denormalized (e.g., `author`, `members` maps, `sellerId`, `instructorId`) to maintain consistency and avoid server-side reads during authorization.
